data.text: @malar0ne Well at least Scott Atlas has gotten one thing right in history
@malar0ne @DrOz Hmmm. It might actually be worth a new post that revisits those old posts. I'll have to think about it.
@gorskon @DrOz I think it's a worthwhile update! Also a good case study in understanding the contours of denialism and importance of context

@malar0ne @DrOz I'm half tempted to go back to that post and add a note with links to stuff about Scott Atlas from eight years in the future (i.e., now) just to point out the connections. I might also find recent posts in which I mention Atlas and add a link to that old post...
@gorskon @DrOz Went down a bit of a rabbithole today & wasn't surprised that you were on the case at the time!

@malar0ne @DrOz It didn't really take any particular insight on my part. It seemed mind-numbingly obvious to me, and I keep wondering why it wasn't so obvious to those who signed the letter. I had forgotten, though, that Scott Atlas had signed that letter!
@gorskon @DrOz Seems like your intuition was pretty spot-on here
@malar0ne And, predictably, @DrOz did exactly what I predicted to neuter the criticism. https://t.co/guNBmF8wTA
